content.description: Although this is a very short route, it stays real from the first move until the last.  Originally there were only 2 bolts on the route and a fall while clipping the anchors coupled with a less than perfect belay would have resulted in a possible ground fall.  Thus, a third bolt was added on 8/28/21 to address this scenario.  With the 3rd bolt now in place, the route no longer deserves an "R" rating.
content.location: This is the first route just to the right of "High Hanging Fruit."

content.description: You can avoid the first crux on the bottom half of the route by skirting slightly to the right before rejoining the route.  This drops the rating a couple letters.
content.location: Furthest right route on the wall. Two past the center crack - High Hanging Fruit.

climbs.name: High Hanging Fruit (A.K.A. Legends of the Green)
climbs.fa: Tim Anderson, Dave Lynn, Bryce Dillinger

content.description: There is a very sequential 5.9 section on the bottom of this route that is protected by two bolts.  The hand crack on the top is not more than 5.6.  The bolts on the face below will allow a new trad leader to feel safe as they work on their gear game.
content.protection: Two bolts and then one or two cams in the crack.

content.description: This route has the same start as Convergence. Climb up to, and over, the same rooflet, but then head up and left on a rising diagonal and head to the set of anchors on the left side of the wall.
content.location: Left of High Hanging Fruit. Same start as Convergence.

content.description: Begin just left of "High Hanging Fruit." Climb up to the small rooflet half way up the route and then follow the right facing flake to the top.  This route shares anchors with "High Hanging Fruit."
content.location: Climb just to the left of High Hanging Fruit.

content.description: This area is even further to the right of The Right Wall. If you are looking at the three old climbs on the high side of The Cannabis Boulder, this is the short wall that will be directly behind you.  The distinguishing feature on this wall is the hand crack of "High Hanging Fruit" that goes up the top half of that route which is in the middle of the wall.
